paper_abstract: In this paper, we present a broadcast encryption scheme with efficient transmission cost under the log-key restriction. Given n users and r revoked users, our scheme has the transmission cost of O(r) and requires the storage of O(log n) keys at each receiver. These are optimal complexities in broadcast encryptions using one-way hash functions (or pseudo-random generators.) To achieve these complexities, the stratified subset difference (SSD) scheme and the B1 scheme were introduced by Goodrich et al. and Hwang et al. respectively. However, their schemes have the disadvantage that transmission cost increases linearly according to the number of stratifications. By assigning the related keys between stratifications, our scheme remedies the defect and achieves very efficient transmission cost even in an environment where the key storage is restricted. To the best of our knowledge, our scheme has the most efficient transmission cost in the existing schemes with log-key storage. In addition, our result is comparable to other schemes that allow a large key storage.
paper_title: Efficient broadcast encryption scheme with log-key storage
